result.execSummary:
The defendant Aliza Staphfine Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid $50.00 per month commencing 07/15/22 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cases 22TR1657 and 22TR1658 are dismissed and read in.

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Priya Barnes
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

03:01 PM Defendant Aliza Staphfine Richardson in court with attorney Priya Barnes.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties have reached an agreement. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Cases 22TR1657 and 22TR1658 are dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
FINE: $ 694.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $ 50.00  per month commencing 7/15/22.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant to set up wage assignment.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

Repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing April 15, 2022. (BC)
*In boxed to Business Center- MAM**

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing April 15, 2022.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
